name: Super Mario Bros. 2
description:
The Princess has been kidnapped by King Koopa (again) and it's up to Mario and Luigi to save her (again). Not to be confused with the western Super Mario Bros. 2, this sequel to Super Mario Bros. is very much an expansion to the original, with many reused graphics and concepts, though new ones are also present.

Instead of offering a two-player mode as in the original, this game allows you to choose between a Mario mode and a Luigi mode, with each character handling differently. Mario has tighter ground control, while Luigi has greater jumping capabilities.

Power-ups remain the same: Super Mushrooms grow a brother from small to Super size, Fire Flowers give them the ability to throw fireballs at enemies, Starman makes a character temporarily invincible, and a 1-Up Mushroom will give one more life. New to this game is a power-down, a Poison Mushroom which will harm you as if it were an enemy.

The goal is still to survive from the left side of the level to the right, avoiding perils and bopping enemies along the way, progressing through a series of 8 worlds with 4 levels each. That is, unless a warp zone is found allowing areas to be skipped. There are new tricks that work for and against the player, though. Some piranha plants will come out of their pipe even if you're standing right next to them, and bloobers now appear outside of the water. Wind can be present to alter how jumps will behave. Some warp zones will actually take the player to an earlier level instead of to a later one.
alsoFor: Game Boy Advance, Nintendo 3DS, Nintendo Switch, Wii, Wii U | Combined View

shot.caption: Title screen
Starting a new game.  Everything looks similar, but different.
Pipes level with the ground and a poison mushroom
Jumping from falling platform to falling platform; this game gets tricky even in the second level.
That's as far as you'll take me?
Flying bloober
Every fourth level is still a castle.
Again?
Green springs allow you to jump higher than the screen can show.
There's a 120+ 1-up possibility right in the beginning of level 1-1
Again? Is there a way out of here?
A hard to reach vine, but there's a possibility of a shortcut or warp
One of coin heavens
The ocean is very hostile in this game as well
A series of very tough jumps. You need to fully understand and feel the game's physics to complete these jumps
I'm gonna get you Koopas... Every last one of you
Jump too high and you're history
This game has a lot of timed jumps
The wind enables Mario to cover extra distance
These blocks were invisible, so at first I thought I was trapped here
Luigi jumps much higher than Mario, but his running momentum is hard to control
So many things are happening at once in this screen
It's a one-time jump opportunity.
Don't panic Mario. You can do it...
7-3 is a peculiar level almost entirely designed over springs
Will Mario make this high jump? Spoiler: he will.
Easy now...
This new coin room is hazardous
Even in the skies Bowser's minions won't leave Mario alone
Yeah, there's a huge aquarium in Bowser's castle. Deal with it.
OK, you made it this far, now good luck getting inside that pipe
Hey fake Bowser, you don't fool me here
So tough to get through this fight. But with patience it can be done
OK, first levels of the secret World 9 are underwater, but there are clouds... What were they smoking?
This is still underwater
When you die in any of the secret worlds, you get this special game over screen
Good luck avoiding Bowser in this tight spot!
The final level of the secret World 9 spells "Arigatou!" with blocks.
Secret World A. The design is very hostile, get prepared to die a lot.
High-precision jumping required.
Tough spot, tough luck
Hesitate another moment and you're dead
Some levels in secret worlds are harder variations of levels from the base game. For example, this is a variant of level 7-3
Hey regular Mario player, how about trying to get past this obstacle? The thing spins clockwise, mind you, right in your face.
Wait...jump-run-jump... fail, repeat.
This hellish spring jump took me so many tries to figure out and do at least with 50% consistency
Oh boy. They sure wanna destroy poor Mario.
Welcome to bullet hell
